data.title: Should I Visit Leipzig or Dusseldorf? Which is Better for Attractions, Food, Families, and Couples? Which is Cheaper? Which is More Expensive?
data.meta_description: Should I Visit Leipzig or Dusseldorf? Which is Better for Attractions, Food, Families, and Couples? Which is Cheaper? Which is More Expensive? | Budget Your Trip.
data.text:
Should you visit Leipzig or Dusseldorf?

Which is cheaper to visit? Which is more expensive for vacation?

If you're trying to decide where to visit between Leipzig or Dusseldorf, this travel comparison, which includes costs, can help. The overall cost of travel is usually a consideration when deciding where to go next, and the cost comparison down below can help you decide based on the average prices from other travelers along with your own travel budget.

Leipzig

Leipzig is a dynamic, cultural, and historic city. This is a quaint and attractive place to visit, too. It's also known for shopping, museums, and nightlife.

Dusseldorf

Dusseldorf is a vibrant, historic, and fun-filled city. Since it's a large city, you'll find plenty of things to do. Other reasons to visit include museums, nightlife, and food.

Leipzig and Dusseldorf: Pros and Cons

Is there more to do in Leipzig or Dusseldorf?

Travelers will usually find more to do in Dusseldorf than Leipzig, as it is bigger with more sights, attractions, and activities for visitors. Dusseldorf is more popular for its food, historical sights, and big city activities, while Leipzig is known for its museums & sights, shopping, and quaint atmosphere. Leipzig is popular for being the home of several great musicians such as Bach and Richard Wagner. Dusseldorf is popular for its music and art scene, as well as being the fashion capital of Germany. It is also home to Altstadt (the Old Town).

How is Leipzig different from Dusseldorf?

Which is Better for a Holiday?

Let's take a look at the differences and similarities between Dusseldorf and Leipzig. Then, you can decide for yourself which place is better for your next trip.

Are the Museums and Historical Sights Better in Leipzig or Dusseldorf?

Leipzig

Dusseldorf

Leipzig is a great destination for its museums and landmarks. Also, Dusseldorf is still popular, but not quite as popular for its historical sights.

Visitors can fill many days exploring the museums and attractions around Leipzig. There are many historic landmarks like Old City Hall, St. Thomas Church, St. Nicholas Church, and the Battle of the Nations Monument.

Dusseldorf offers a variety of museums and landmarks to choose from. There are museums, palaces, and many cultural sights. Make sure you check out Schloss Benrath, the Rheinturm, the North Rhine-Westphalia Art Collection, and Museum Kunstpalast.

Is the Food Better in Leipzig or Dusseldorf? Which Destination has the Best Restaurants?

Leipzig

Dusseldorf

Dusseldorf is great for its local flavors and cuisine. Also, Leipzig is not as popular, but is still a nice city for its local cuisine and restaurants.

The food selection at local restaurants is excellent in Dusseldorf. You'll find a mix of regional specialties and international restaurant options. Traditional dishes include Rheinischer Sauerbraten (Rhine style marinated roast), Haxe (shin), Flönz (blood sausage), and Ähzezupp (pea soup).

Visitors will find a budding food and restaurant scene in Leipzig. Coffee houses and cellar restaurants offer an unique atmosphere where you can enjoy local specialties. Sample beef roulade or Saxon dumplings while you soak up the cozy ambiance.

Is Leipzig or Dusseldorf Better for Nightlife?

Leipzig

Dusseldorf

The vibe at night is good in both Leipzig and Dusseldorf.

If you're looking for night time activities Leipzig has a few options to choose from. Nightlife in town centers around live theater, cultural centers, and live entertainment.

There's a variety of activities in the evening in Dusseldorf. You'll find the highest concentration of bars and pubs in the old town area. Try to find a brewerie where you can try Dusseldorf's famous altbier.

Is Leipzig or Dusseldorf Better for its Old Town?

Leipzig

Dusseldorf

Dusseldorf is great for its historic old town. However, Leipzig does not have a historic old town.

Many visitors go to Dusseldorf to see the historical old town. The old town is popular for its bars and pubs, which serve up the local altbier. The atmosphere is charming and there are restaurants that spill out onto the streets.

Leipzig does not have a historic old town.

Is the Shopping Better in Leipzig or Dusseldorf?

Leipzig

Dusseldorf

Leipzig is a great destination for shopping. Also, Dusseldorf is still popular, but not quite as popular for its shopping opportunities.

Leipzig is an extremely popular place for shoppers. The city center has most of the best shopping areas. There are pedestrian streets and squares like Petersstraße and Marktplatz, as well as large shopping malls like Promenaden Hauptbahnhof Leipzig and Petersbogen.

Shopping is a popular activity when visiting Dusseldorf. Head to the popular shopping street of Königsallee. You'll find luxury brands and boutique shops. The city also has department stores and large shopping malls.

Is Leipzig or Dusseldorf Better for Families?

Leipzig

Dusseldorf

Dusseldorf is great for its kid-friendly activities. Also, Leipzig is not as popular, but is still a nice city for its family-friendly activities.

Dusseldorf is a very family-friendly destination. It has many great playgrounds and parks where kids can run around. Animal lovers will appreciate Aquazoo Löbbecke Museum and Grafenberger Wald which has about 100 animals. If the weather's nice you can head to Unterbacher See, which is a lakefront beach. Other kid-friendly activities in town include the Neanderthal Museum and Museum Kunstpalast.

Leipzig is a family-friendly place to visit. Head to Belantis, which is an amusement park with rides, or take the kids to one of the many parks like Clara-Zetkin Park where they can unwind. The Leipzig Zoo makes a nice outing as well or Maya Mare is a fun waterpark. There are also several good museums like the Leipzig Panometer.

Is Leipzig or Dusseldorf Better for Couples?

Leipzig

Dusseldorf

Dusseldorf is great for romance. Also, Leipzig is not as popular, but is still a nice city for its romantic activities.

Dusseldorf is a great city if you're traveling as a couple. There is live theater, spa hotels, historic palaces, and many parks and gardens where couples can enjoy their time together. Popular activities for couples in town include visiting Rheinturm, taking a Rhine River cruise, and exploring Schloss Dyck.

Leipzig makes for a fun place to visit for a couple. There are many beautiful outdoor parks and natural areas where couples can enjoy this beautiful city.

Is Leipzig or Dusseldorf Better for Backpackers and Budget Travelers?

Leipzig

Dusseldorf

For backpackers, both Leipzig and Dusseldorf are good places to visit.

It's common for backpackers to visit Leipzig. Many backpackers overlook this city, but there are a few hostels and some nice areas to explore for those who make their way here.

Dusseldorf is a good city to visit for backpackers. There are plenty of hostels and activities around town. There are also affordable restaurants and a nice nightlife scene.

Is Leipzig or Dusseldorf Better for Public Transit? Which Is Easier to Get Around Without a Car?

Leipzig

Dusseldorf

Dusseldorf is terrific for times when you don't have a car. Also, Leipzig is not as popular, but is still a nice city for its public transit.

The thorough and effecient public transit system of Dusseldorf can take you anywhere. All of the public transportation in town is operated by Rheinbahn. There's a city railway, (U-Bahn), suburban trains (S-Bahn), trams, and buses. Dusseldorf is also easily connected to the many other nearby towns and cities including Cologne.

Public transit in Leipzig can get you to some places easily. The city has 61 bus lines and 13 tram lines that connect Leizpig to elsewhere in the region.

Is Leipzig or Dusseldorf a more walkable city?

Leipzig

Dusseldorf

Dusseldorf is great for its walkability. Also, Leipzig is not as popular, but is still a nice city for its high level of walkability.

Dusseldorf is very walkable. It's easy to explore most of the city on foot.

Leipzig is a somewhat walkable place. Parts of Leizpig are more walkable than others.

For even more information, also check out Is Leipzig Worth Visiting? and Is Dusseldorf Worth Visiting?.

Should I spend more time in Dusseldorf or Leipzig?

How long in Leipzig or Dusseldorf?

Visitors can find plenty of fun things to do in both Leipzig and Dusseldorf. In our opinion, Dusseldorf has more to see and do, so we recommend spending more time in Dusseldorf than Leipzig. In general, 1-3 days is a good amount of time for Leipzig, and 2-3 days is enough time in Dusseldorf.

Families should spend more time in Dusseldorf than Leipzig. Because of the many family-friendly attractions and fun things to do for kids in Dusseldorf, it's a great place to visit with the whole family.

Couples should spend more time in Dusseldorf than Leipzig. You'll find plenty of romantic sights and fun activities in Dusseldorf that are perfect for a weekend getaway or a longer couple's trip.

Backpackers and budget travelers should spend more time in Dusseldorf than Leipzig if your budget allows for it. With a larger number of budget-friendly sights, good nightlife, and active things to do, anyone traveling on a budget would have a good time in Dusseldorf.
